author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Uploads a file for sandbox analysis.
commands.name: cs-fx-upload-file

commands.description: Submits a sample SHA256 hash for sandbox analysis.
commands.name: cs-fx-submit-uploaded-file

commands.description: Gets a full version of a sandbox report.
commands.name: cs-fx-get-full-report

commands.description: Gets a short summary version of a sandbox report.
commands.name: cs-fx-get-report-summary

commands.description: Checks the status of a sandbox analysis.
commands.name: cs-fx-get-analysis-status

commands.description: Returns the total quota number and the in use quota number.
commands.name: cs-fx-check-quota

commands.description: Finds sandbox reports by providing an FQL filter and paging details.
commands.name: cs-fx-find-reports

commands.description: Finds submission IDs for uploaded files by providing an FQL filter and paging details. Returns a set of submission IDs that match the search criteria.
commands.name: cs-fx-find-submission-id

commands.description: Gets reputation data for one or more files, by sha256 hashes.
commands.name: file

commands.description: Submits a URL or FTP for sandbox analysis.
commands.name: cs-fx-submit-url

commands.description: Downloads IOC packs, PCAP files, and other analysis artifacts.
commands.name: cs-fx-download-ioc

integration.description: Use the CrowdStrike Falcon X integration to submit files, file hashes, URLs, and FTPs for sandbox analysis, and to retrieve reports.
integration.name: CrowdStrike Falcon X

playbook.description:
Detonates a File using CrowdStrike Falcon X sandbox.
Accepted file formats:
Portable executables: .exe, .scr, .pif, .dll, .com, .cpl, etc.
Office documents: .doc, .docx, .ppt, .pps, .pptx, .ppsx, .xls, .xlsx, .rtf, .pub
PDF
APK
Executable JAR
Windows script component: .sct
Windows shortcut: .lnk
Windows help: .chm
HTML application: .hta
Windows script file: .wsf
Javascript: .js
Visual Basic: .vbs, .vbe
Shockwave Flash: .swf
Perl: .pl
Powershell: .ps1, .psd1, .psm1
Scalable vector graphics: .svg
Python: .py
Linux ELF executables
Email files: MIME RFC 822 .eml, Outlook .msg.
playbook.name: Detonate File - CrowdStrike Falcon X

playbook.description: This playbook uploads, detonates, and analyzes files for the Falcon X sandbox.
playbook.name: FalconX Detonate and Analyze File

playbook.description: Detonate one or more files using the CrowdStrike Falcon Sandbox integration. This playbook returns relevant reports to the War Room and file reputations to the context data.
playbook.name: Detonate URL - CrowdStrike Falcon X

name: CrowdStrike FalconX
readme:
CrowdStrike Falcon X is an automated threat intelligence service built on the Falcon platform.

It provides rich content and actionable information to malware analysts and security teams to aid in their malware evaluation. It gives context around the behavior of malicious files and outlines the risk assessment providing related samples. Having this research at your fingertips can aid in the larger investigation.

Understanding malware behavior can help you identify and address potential areas of weakness to stay ahead of potential attacks. 

## What does this pack do?
- Automatically analyze malware found on endpoints.
- Determine if there are related samples from other malware search engines.
- Enrich results with customized threat intelligence.
- Provide security teams with custom indicators of compromise (IOCs).
- Show not only what happened on the endpoint, but also details behind the attack.


## Playbooks
This pack includes the following built-in playbooks:
- **Detonate File - CrowdStrike Falcon X**: Detonate a file using CrowdStrike Falcon X sandbox.
- **Detonate URL - CrowdStrike Falcon X**: Detonate one or more files using the CrowdStrike Falcon Sandbox integration. This playbook returns relevant reports to the War Room and file reputations to the context data.
